metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0562 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Null source pointer passed as an argument to memcpy() function within TIFFReadDirectory() in tif_dirread.c in libtiff versions from 4.0 to 4.3.0 could lead to Denial of Service via crafted TIFF file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, a fix is available with commit 561599c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0562` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm1
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm1').
